sculptor module

class Sculptor(performance_file_name, params_file_name, settings_file_name, m)[source]

Bases: object

Sculptor is a calculator of plane geometry. It uses parametrs and a some requirements (performance) to calculate geometry and weidth of a plane.

__init__(performance_file_name, params_file_name, settings_file_name, m)[source]

The Sculptor class initializer.

Parameters:

  • performance_file_name (str) – The name of file, where performance is defined. It must be an .csv file, filled in a certain way. For more information, see the section performance file format.

  • params_file_name (str) – The name of file, where params is defined. It must be an .csv file, filled in a certain way. For more information, see the section params file format.

  • settings_file_name (str) – The name of file, where settings is defined. It must be an .csv file, filled in a certain way. For more information, see the section settings file format.

  • m (float) – a first approximation of the plane mass value.

Returns:

none

calculate_geometry()[source]

Geometry calculation.

This function fills the geom data frames using functions from the aerolib library

Returns:

none

get_data_to_weigh()[source]

A hendler to use weight-function

Read more about the weight function

Returns:

a list with the file names params_file_name and geom_file_name

Return type:

list

preprocess_params()[source]

Checking the parameter dataframe - params

The developers have set a list of critical parameters. That is, those without which the calculation will not make sense at all. Their values are required. This function checks the dataframe for all critical parameters

Returns:

none

preprocess_performance()[source]

Checking the parameter data frames - performance

The developers have set a list of critical parameters. That is, those without which the calculation will not make sense at all. Their values are required. This function checks the dataframe for all critical parameters

Returns:

none

preprocess_settings()[source]

Checking the parameter dataframe - settings

The developers have set a list of critical parameters. That is, those without which the calculation will not make sense at all. Their values are required. This function checks the dataframe for all critical parameters

Returns:

none

update_m(new_m)[source]

A simple setter.

This function sets a new value to tom

Returns:

Writing to a file

Writing to a file

write_info()[source]

Writing to a file

Writes the contents of the aero and geom data frames to the aero_file_name and geom_file_name files

Returns:

none

aero

Dataframe formed from aero_file_name-file

aero_file_name: str

The name of file, where cruising characteristics will be placed. Сurrently not supported!

geom: dict

Dataframe formed from geom_file_name-file

geom_file_name: str

The name of file, where geometry of plane will be placed.

params: dict

Dataframe formed from params_file_name-file

params_file_name: str

The name of file, where performance is defined.

performance: dict

Dataframe formed from performance_file_name-file

settings: dict

Dataframe formed from settings_file_name-file

tom

The weight of the aircraft in kilograms
